intro: Parsonsia balsamona, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution in suitable habitats.
